donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr:
PHASE 1 AND 2: up to 30 November 2012: The major objectives are to: (i) improve knowledge and practice of HIV and Sexually Transmitted Infections (STI) preventative measures by the general adult population, youth and vulnerable population subgroups during 2005-2010: (ii) develop and expand treatment, and care and support services for people and families living with HIV/AIDS: and (iii) build the capacity of Southern Sudan HIV/AIDS Commission (SSAC), NGOs and local institutions to effectively manage and monitor HIV/AIDS programmes
CONTINUITY OF SERVICES: from 1 December 2011 to 30 November 2013: to provide continued life-long treatment for PMTCT, OIs and CTX, and ART

donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr: The key components of the project will include the establishment of TB/HIV joint Technical Coordinating Units in the MoH-GoSS, organise national level TB/HIV planning meetings to review and evaluate progress, establish an Advocacy, Communication and Social Mobilisation (ACSM) Unit, monitoring and evaluation of collaborative TB/HIV activities, increased TB case findings among PLWHA, provision of treatment for latent TB infection for HIV positive patients, and the provision of infection control services in health care settings and or congregate settings.

donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr: Contributing to the improvement of quality of life of the people of South Sudan by reducing dramatically the burden of TB in South Sudan by 2015 in line with Millennium Development Goals and stop TB Partnerships targets

donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr: Output 1:South Sudan health systems workforce capacities strengthened
